alert.note: Alert for Butler; Ohio (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 08 at 11:43PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Butler and southwestern Ohio Counties through 1115 PM CDT... At 1042 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles east of Central City, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Butler and southwestern Ohio Counties, including the following locations... Prentiss, Shultztown, Mining City, Rochester, Nineteen, Scottown, Cromwell, Gilstrap, Logansport and Cool Springs. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
